programme.title: En route vers les sommets
programme.desc: Mountain rescue Departure at sunrise. One of the candidates must drop out. Injured the previous day, he needs to be airlifted by helicopter. The young climbers provide first aid. There'll be no helicopter rescue on the expedition. Director: Martin Schilt (season 2, Switzerland, 2021)

programme.title: Une brique dans le ventre
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Épicerie fine
programme.desc:
The Mancelles Alps
At the GAEC de la Phacélie, deep in the hills and valleys of the Mancelles Alps, Gaël collects propolis from his hives. Cyril and Florence grow Damask roses. One thing is clear: catching butterflies is no easy business! All about the Confrérie des Fins Goustiers du Haut-Maine et Pail.
Presented by: Guy Martin Directed by: Émilie Darnaud (France, 2022)

programme.title: La tête à l'endroit
programme.desc: Warming yourself in Haut-Doubs: mission impossible? Spanning Doubs, Switzerland and Jura, at an altitude of 1,000 metres we find the Val de Mouthe. In the white wonderland of Haut-Doubs, you'd be forgiven for thinking that you're at the North Pole, in the forests of Lapland. Is it possible to get warm in Haut-Doubs ? Presenter: Guillaume Pierre.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Exploring the French National Archives. Encounter with Émilie Bonaventure, the multidisciplinary creator at the head of the Be-Attitude agency: design, scenography, art, architecture. Paris in the footsteps of the writer Simone de Beauvoir. With Papiers à Êtres, Sophie Mouton-Perrat and Frédéric Guibrunet offer radiant, diaphanous sculptures as light as paper. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: #chicenVF
programme.desc: In Paris for a rendezvous behind the scenes at the Sainte-Chapelle as we discover the hidden side of this religious monument. We then meet the young Swiss designer Eliane Heutschi, an up-and-coming talent in the world of fashion who mixes materials and techniques for her resolutely modern creations. Commentary: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: #VF
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Les ambassadeurs
programme.desc: The beautiful villages of the Pays de Herve We take a wander through the Pays de Herve, in the Province of Liège, from one beautiful village to the next: Olne, Soiron, Clermont-sur-Berwinne. So many delightful spots to take a break amidst the patchwork of fields, copses and hedgerows, the stone-built houses and the footpaths. Presented by: Armelle, Guy Lemaire, Jean-Philippe Watteyne.

programme.title: En route vers les sommets
programme.desc: The thinning air The last 200 metres to the peak of Mont-Blanc require a great deal of energy from the young climbers. Nothing is certain. During the expedition, they hope to go at least 1000 metres higher. Until then, they also learn how to attract money and sponsors. Director: Martin Schilt (season 2, Switzerland, 2021)

programme.title: Une brique dans le ventre
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Épicerie fine
programme.desc:
The Diois
We head for the Diois, in the company of Alain, to discover a world of colour and scent in his lavender fields. Céline collects pollen from her hives. A watery journey, through the Bouligons marshes and along the river Drôme. All about the Clairette de Die.
Presented by: Guy Martin Directed by: Émilie Darnaud (France, 2022)

programme.title: La tête à l'endroit
programme.desc: Natural attractions near Dijon A few kilometres from Dijon, between the river and the forest, lies a land boasting many resources: the Val-Suzon. Guillaume sets off to meet the fans of this conservation area where the forest is still a source of great emotion... And truffles! Presenter: Guillaume Pierre.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at the Cordouan lighthouse that guards the mouth of the Gironde estuary. Encounter with Jean-Michel Othoniel, artist, creating poetical yet militant sculptures. A stroll through Paris to discover some of its best Art Nouveau addresses. Focus on Aurore Thuault, a textile designer turning embroidery into contemporary art. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: #chicenVF
programme.sub-title: Nathanaël Désormeaux et Damien Carrette/Le verre
programme.desc: Encounter with Nathanaël Désormeaux and Damien Carrette who open the doors to their world of design with its fun pop ambiance. Thomas Segaud, glass-blower, recounts his passion. Commentary: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: Les ambassadeurs
programme.desc: The beautiful villages of the Pays de Herve We take a wander through the Pays de Herve, in the Province of Liège, from one beautiful village to the next: Olne, Soiron, Clermont-sur-Berwinne. So many delightful spots to take a break amidst the patchwork of fields, copses and hedgerows, the stone-built houses and the footpaths. Presented by: Armelle, Guy Lemaire, Jean-Philippe Watteyne.

programme.title: En route vers les sommets
programme.desc: The thinning air The last 200 metres to the peak of Mont-Blanc require a great deal of energy from the young climbers. Nothing is certain. During the expedition, they hope to go at least 1000 metres higher. Until then, they also learn how to attract money and sponsors. Director: Martin Schilt (season 2, Switzerland, 2021)

programme.title: Tendance XXI
programme.desc: Spotlight on headgear by La Cerise sur le Chapeau. All there is to know about the roll neck. Encounter with André Sakellarides, stringed-instrument maker in Marseille. How to wear wellington boots. A deliciously sweet visit to a veritable institution in Lille: Maison Meert reveals the recipe for its waffles. Commentary: Viviane Blassel.

programme.title: Papilles
programme.desc:
François Gagnaire
Chef François Gagnaire, today based in Paris, returns to the Haute-Loire and his town of Le Puy-en-Velay, where he has never been forgotten. We accompany him on a distinctly foodie pilgrimage, across the region that revealed his talent and where he earned his first Michelin star.
Presented by: Emmanuelle Delteil.

programme.title: La belle vie
programme.desc: Life on a multigenerational farm In Saskatchewan, Julien settles on a farm that's totally off-grid and into the radically ecological lifestyle of its inhabitants. And he's about to learn a lot from this family that lives its convictions to the full! Presented by: Julien Roussin-Côté.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Fashion special Behind the scenes at the Grévin Museum. Encounter with Jason Basmajian, artistic director for Cerruti 1881, a Parisian fashion house with a Hollywood accent and Italian roots. Paris, in the footsteps of the designer Yves Saint Laurent. The feather obeys his every whim, Maxime Leroy, feather artisan. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: #chicenVF
programme.desc: In Paris for a rendezvous behind the scenes at the Sainte-Chapelle as we discover the hidden side of this religious monument. We then meet the young Swiss designer Eliane Heutschi, an up-and-coming talent in the world of fashion who mixes materials and techniques for her resolutely modern creations. programme.title: Vachement Normand !
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Ricardo
programme.desc:
Beet cupcakes
Ricardo prepares a root vegetable for dessert: beet cupcakes topped with mascarpone cream and drizzled with beet syrup.
Presented by: Ricardo Larrivée.

programme.title: Littoral
programme.desc:
En-route for the Gras de Douarnenez
With five days of festivities the Gras de Douarnenez is a carnival on a grand scale! One of the last in Brittany or even in France, this fabulous celebration, open to everyone and every age, sees the entire town dress up and enjoy a chance to laugh at absolutely anything. Report by: Nina Montagné.
Presented by: Marine Barnérias.

programme.title: Version Française
programme.desc:
The Liberation of Paris Museum/Pierre Marty/Off-White/Plumavera.
The Liberation of Paris Museum recounts the Second World War. Chef Pierre Marty at work in the kitchens of "Ducasse sur Seine", a boat unlike any other. Off-White, with its extravagant fabrics and over-sized volumes. An in-depth look at Plumavera's exquisite expertise with feathers.
Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: 5 chefs dans ma cuisine
programme.sub-title: Magret de canard aux quatre baies
programme.desc: Duck breast with a four pepper sauce Pasquale Vari presents her duck breast with roast Brussels sprouts and explains how to make a four pepper sauce. Presented by: Marina Orsini. Directed by: Nicole Dussault, David Gauthier, Stéphane Rocheleau, Léo Boulanger (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Nos maisons
programme.desc: Maison de vétéran In the middle of the 20th century, to solve the housing crisis, Canada saw the construction of tens of thousands of quick-build houses, each to the same square design: known as "wartime housing" or "maisons de vétérans". Directed by: Mathieu Baer (Canada, 2019)

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #chicenVF
programme.desc: Fun, colourful and made in France, Jean-Simon Roch's creations impress both young and old alike. The designer invites us to explore his magical world. Then, to discover all there is to know about wood, we meet the cabinetmaker Morgane Ricada. Commentary: Katherina Marx.

programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Louis et la faune urbaine
programme.desc:
Brock and East York, Ontario
In Brock, Ontario, Louis saves the life of a large number of frogs. In Toronto, he comes to the rescue of six skunks.
Presenter: Louis Larose.

programme.title: Curieux Bégin
programme.desc: Nordic food Three guests born in Scandinavia come together to cook dishes from their respective regions: Sweden, Norway and Denmark. Mahée Paiement joins the gang to relive her travel memories! Presented by: Christian Bégin.

programme.title: Histoire(s) de jardins
programme.sub-title: Le best of de la saison
programme.desc: Season's highlights For this final programme, Katharina Locher catches up with the gardeners in an exceptional spot: the MFO Park in Zurich. Between walls and columns of greenery, they look back at the best moments of the season. Presented by: Katharina Locher.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at the Légion d'Honneur Museum. Designer and interior designer, Emmanuelle Simon creates a world of curves with a Japanese accent. In the footsteps of Olympe de Gouges. Manal Paris presents a range of ethical sustainable jewellery, exclusively made-to-measure using recycled gold. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.sub-title: Nathanaël Désormeaux et Damien Carrette/Le verre
